What is a Canada Student Visa?

A Canada Student Visa is a unique document issued to foreign students who wish to study at any designated learning institution (DLI) in Canada. To obtain a Student Visa for Canada from India,  you must apply for a Canadian Study Permit first. There is no age limit for a Canada student visa. Although you will have to prove your intentions to return to your home country after completing your studies. You may apply for a Study Permit after a Long Gap, with the help of a solid case file and adequate documentation, and avoid study permit refusal.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Requirements for Canada Student Visa from India

You must generally meet the following requirements to be eligible for a Canadian student visa:

  1. You must be fully vaccinated.
  2. You must be enrolled in a Designated Learning Institution
  3. You must provide Proof of Financial Support to support your life and studies in Canada
  4. You must have no criminal record
  5. Good physical and mental health needs to be proved.
  6. Provide evidence to prove intention to leave Canada after completion of studies

use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1668672723157{margin-top: 20px !important;}” el_id=”document-checklist”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1668673067716{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]Indian students that wish to pursue higher education in Canada must obtain a Canadian student visa and a Canada study permit. A Canada study visa consultant can typically help with this process. A Canada student visa allows foreign students from India to enter Canada, while a study permit allows them to study at educational institutions there.

The required documents for a Canada Student Visa from India include:

  • A valid passport
  • Copies of your 10th, 12th, and degree certificates
  • Two academic references
  • Two employer references
  • A statement of purpose
  • Certificates related to extracurricular achievements
  • A valid letter of acceptance from an educational institution
  • Proof of application payment
  • Proof that you possess enough funds
  • Passport size photos
  • Proof of proficiency in English

Please reach out to the Canada student visa consultants at Colossus Migration for additional clarification on any of the above requirements.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” top_padding=”5%” bottom_padding=”5%” left_padding_desktop=”8%” right_padding_desktop=”8%” top_padding_phone=”15%” bottom_padding_phone=”15%” left_padding_phone=”7%” right_padding_phone=”7%” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”Working While Studying in Canada” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1668672749411{margin-top: 20px !important;}” el_id=”work-while-studying”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1639487969966{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]Prospective Indian students over the age of 18 can work while studying in Canada under certain circumstances.
They can work:

  • On or off-campus for up to 20 hours per week during their semester without a work permit.
  • Full-time during winter and summer breaks without a work permit.
  • During co-op semesters using a co-op work permit if they are enrolled in a co-op or internship program.

Canada Student Visa Application Process

The steps for applying for a student visa to Canada are listed below:

STEP 1: Determine Your Eligibility

The students must determine if they can fulfill the aforementioned eligibility requirements, out of which receiving a Letter of Acceptance is the top priority. Check if you are eligible for Canada Student Visa from India: FREE Evaluation Tool.

STEP 2: Prepare Your Study Permit Application

After that, students gather the application-related paperwork. They are listed in the Document Checklist for the Canadian Student Permit. Feel free to contact us if need help with your Canadian student visa application process.

STEP 3: Submit Your Canada Student Visa Application

Students can then fill out and submit a Study Permit application online or using a paper-based process. The online process can be completed at the IRCC website. Applications submitted via the paper-based process must be submitted to a Visa Application Center (VAC) in their country.

Then, students can complete and submit a Study Permit application, either online or on paper. Paper-based applications must be submitted to a regional Visa Application Center (VAC).

STEP 4: Wait for a Decision

Next, the students wait for the approval of their Canadian student visa. Depending on the nation you are applying from, a typical Canadian study visa takes 90 days (13 weeks) to be approved.

STEP 5: Move to Canada

Accepted students can take a flight to Canada. The Canadian student visa will be handed to you at the border crossing.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”2/3″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1668667163462{margin-bottom: 5% !important;}”]
